name: Inventory
description: Interface to the various inventories available to players, monsters and blocks.

methods.name: getSize
methods.description: Returns the size of the inventory.

methods.name: getMaxStackSize
methods.description: Returns the maximum stack size for a ItemStack in this inventory.

methods.name: setMaxStackSize
methods.description: This method allows you to change the maximum stack size for an inventory.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The new maximum stack size for items in this inventory.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Returns the name of the inventory.

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Returns the ItemStack found in the slot at the given index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the Slot's ItemStack to return.

methods.name: setItem
methods.description: Stores the ItemStack at the given index of the inventory.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index where to put the ItemStack

methods.name: addItem
methods.description: Stores the given ItemStacks in the inventory.

methods.name: removeItem
methods.description: Removes the given ItemStacks from the inventory.

methods.name: getContents
methods.description: Returns all ItemStacks from the inventory.

methods.name: setContents
methods.description: Completely replaces the inventory's contents. Clears all existing contents and replaces it with the ItemStacks given in the array.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: A complete replacement for the contents; the length must be less than or equal to getSize().

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains any ItemStacks with the given materialId.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains any ItemStacks with the given Material.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains any ItemStacks matching the given ItemStack.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains any ItemStacks with the given materialId, adding to at least the minimum amount specified.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains any ItemStacks with the given Material, adding to at least the minimum amount specified.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains any ItemStacks matching the given ItemStack, adding to at least the minimum amount specified.

methods.name: containsAtLeast
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains at least the minimum amount specified of exactly matching ItemStacks.

methods.name: all
methods.description: Returns a HashMap with all slots and ItemStacks in the inventory with the given materialId.

methods.name: all
methods.description: Returns a HashMap with all slots and ItemStacks in the inventory with the given Material.

methods.name: all
methods.description: Finds all slots and ItemStacks in the inventory with the given ItemStack.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first slot in the inventory containing an ItemStack with the given materialId.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first slot in the inventory containing an ItemStack with the given Material.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first slot in the inventory containing an ItemStack with the given ItemStack.

methods.name: firstEmpty
methods.description: Returns the first empty Slot.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes all ItemStacks from the inventory with the given materialId.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes all ItemStacks from the inventory with the given Material.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes all ItemStacks from the inventory with the given ItemStack.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears out a particular slot in the index.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears out the whole Inventory.

methods.name: getViewers
methods.description: Gets a list of players viewing the inventory. Note that a player is considered to be viewing their own inventory and internal crafting screen even when said inventory is not open. They will normally be considered to be viewing their inventory even when they have a different inventory screen open, but it's possible for customized inventory screens to exclude the viewer's inventory, so this should never be assumed to be non-empty.

methods.name: getTitle
methods.description: Returns the title of this inventory.

methods.name: getType
methods.description: Returns what type of inventory this is.

methods.name: getHolder
methods.description: Gets the block or entity belonging to the open inventory.

methods.name: iterator
methods.description: Returns a ListIterator for the Inventory contents.

methods.name: iterator
methods.description: Returns a ListIterator for the Inventory contents, starting at the specified index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to start the ListIterator at
